original_definition: 'total load' means a load equal to generation and any imports deducting any exports and power used for energy storage;
generated_definition: 'total load' means the total amount of electricity load forecasted for a given time period, including maximum and minimum load values for different time frames (month-ahead, day-ahead, week-ahead, year-ahead).

Article 2: ‘total load’, including losses without power used for energy storage, means a load equal to generation and any imports deducting any exports and power used for energy storage;

‘year-ahead forecast margin’ means the difference between the yearly forecast of available generation capacity and the yearly forecast of maximum total load taking into account the forecast of total generation capacity, the forecast of availability of generation and the forecast of reserves contracted for system services;
